title: MongoDB Atlas Vector Search Overview
description: This dashboard provides an overview of the resource utilization, throughput, and performance of your MongoDB Atlas Vector Search so you can identify and troubleshoot performance issues in one place.

definition.content:
This dashboard provides a high-level overview of your MongoDB Atlas Vector Search performance and usage so you can quickly identify potential slowdowns and resource limitations.

This dashboard will help you monitor your usage of Vector Search in correlation with the rest of your MongoDB Atlas system. Understanding the relation between your overall system memory and disk read IOPS/page faults will help you optimize the allocation of Vector Search resources.

**Refer to the following resources for more information about Vector Search**
- [Atlas Vector Search Overview](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-vector-search/vector-search-overview/)
- [Improve Vector Search Performance](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-vector-search/tune-vector-search/)

definition.title: Atlas max system memory by Cluster

definition.content:
Replication lag refers to the amount of time it takes to copy (i.e. replicate) a write operation on the primary to a secondary. 

Some small delay period may be acceptable, but significant problems emerge as replication lag grows, including building cache pressure on the primary and inconsistent distributed read operations.
